pages.text: I read once that, through some form of long-lost magic, people could turn iron into gold. I might not have the faintest clue how those practitioners of old did it, but I think I now have my own way to do just that - and more.$(br2)  Recalling my old experiment with terrasteel, I've taken the core idea and produced a method of painting that is able to alter something at its most basic level.

Iron, being both so perfectly mundane and rather white in color, proved a wonderful canvas on which to bring other, more colorful metals into being. So far, I've discovered my process only works with nonmagical materials - copper, gold, yttrium, and similar. I may find a way around that problem yet.
